items.title: NAC haalt 120-voudig Ghanees international Andr√© Ayew naar Breda
items.summary: NAC heeft de eerste winteraanwinst al zo goed als binnen. 120-voudig Ghanees international Andr√© Ayew zal zich vanaf de eerste training in het nieuwe jaar bij de selectie van trainer Carl Hoefkens zal voegen.

items.title: Wijnaldum draagt doelpunten op aan overleden oma
items.summary: Georginio Wijnaldum was dinsdag de grote man namens Al-Ettifaq tegen Al-Nassr. De Rotterdammer voorkwam met twee doelpunten dat de ploeg van Cristiano Ronaldo en consorten andermaal een zege boekte in de Saudi Pro League. Voor Al-Nassr was het de eerste keer dat het averij opliep in de elfde speelronde van het seizoen.

items.title: African football hit by fresh allegations over general secretary‚Äôs Caf conduct
items.summary: Gabonese FA president was voted on to Caf exco in 2023 Caf chief allegedly failed to act on reports of sexual abuse The general secretary of the Confederation of African Football (Caf), Veron Mosengo-Omba, ignored a recommendation that Pierre-Alain Mounguengui was ineligible for election to its powerful executive committee because he had been accused of covering up widespread sexual abuse in Gabonese football, it can be revealed. Mounguengui, the president of the Gabonese football federation (Fegafoot), has been accused of failing to act on reports of sexual abuse and rape of young footballers in a series of stories that were first published by the Guardian in 2021. He has denied the allegations and there is no suggestion Mounguengui has been accused of sexual abuse himself. Although he has not yet been formally charged, Mounguengui spent six months in custody awaiting a decision from the authorities in Gabon and was visited by the Caf president, Patrice Motsepe, with a final ruling on his case still pending almost four years on. Continue reading...

items.title: Rechter bepaalt: DAZN moet Belgische competitie uitzenden tot einde seizoen
items.summary: Voetballiefhebbende Belgen kunnen het hart ophalen. De nationale competitie wordt in ieder geval tot het eind van het seizoen uitgezonden door DAZN. Dat heeft arbitragetribunaal CEPANI besloten. De streamingdienst wilde stoppen met het uitzenden van de duels in de Pro League.

items.title: Arsenal go 5 clear in 'great way to end the year'
items.summary: Mikel Arteta labeled Arsenal's 4-1 thrashing of Aston Villa a "great way to end the year," but played down the importance of his team moving five points clear at the top of the Premier League.

items.title: Chelsea defend Palmer sub amid boos at Bridge
items.summary: Chelsea assistant coach Willy Caballero defended the decision to take off Cole Palmer during the 2-2 draw with Bournemouth after supporters at Stamford Bridge reacted furiously to Enzo Maresca's substitution.

items.title: Emery denies Arteta snub after Arsenal beat Villa
items.summary: Unai Emery rejected claims that he snubbed Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta after the full-time whistle in Aston Villa's clash at the Emirates Stadium.

items.title: Kroos rekent mogelijke Oranje-opponent tot favorieten voor WK-eindzege
items.summary: Toni Kroos heeft een opvallende favoriet in zijn hoofd voor de eindzege op het WK 2026. Naast voor de hand liggende landen als Spanje, Portugal en Frankrijk, heeft de Duitser ook hoge verwachtingen van Marokko.

items.title: Wolves breekt als hekkensluiter records in Premier League
items.summary: Wolverhampton Wanderers sloot 2025 na een gelijkspel bij Manchester United af als hekkensluiter in de Premier League. De ploeg van Rob Edwards brak diverse records.

items.title: Are Nancy's 'uncomfortable' Celtic ready for Old Firm?
items.summary: Celtic hirple into Saturday's second league Old Firm derby of the season knowing Rangers can move level on points with a win.

items.title: January transfer window 2026: what every Premier League club needs
items.summary: Aston Villa have a decision to make about Harvey Elliott, Brentford have money to spend and Burnley and Everton need goalscorers A busy summer with the arrival of more than ¬£250m in reinforcements has proved to be invaluable given the number of injuries that have hit Arsenal, particularly in defence. But that also makes any more expensive incomings unlikely in January, especially after the timely return of the influential Gabriel Magalh√£es this week. A loan signing or two could be on the cards, however, with Arsenal not having filled either slot so far after bringing in Neto from Bournemouth and Raheem Sterling from Chelsea last season. Mikel Arteta could do with more cover at right-back and must also decide whether to allow Ethan Nwaneri to go on loan with the 18-year-old having made only three starts in all competitions. items.title: From breakups to contract minefields: it‚Äôs make or break time for academy players
items.summary: Young footballers have big decisions to make at this time of year as academy directors aim to sign the most talented Any 15- or 16-year-olds who should be revising for their mock GCSEs are probably finding that the end of December is a testing time of year. For those in academy football, it can often be make or break. While the very best ‚Äì such as Arsenal‚Äôs record-breaking Max Dowman, who made headlines in October when he agreed terms on a scholarship deal ‚Äì secured their futures in good time, many discovered their fates just before the 31 December deadline. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always the sort of classic breakup. It‚Äôs not you, it‚Äôs us,‚Äù says Dr Chris Platts, who has studied the academy system for more than a decade and offers support to young players and their families. ‚ÄúBeing released before Christmas isn‚Äôt nice for a kid. Then they‚Äôve got about five months before their GCSEs and those five months are now going to include a lot of trials and uncertainty going into the following year.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Clarke reveals 'vindication' after criticism, World Cup plans and Barnes talks
items.summary: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke ended 2024 with some fans criticising his style of play, squad selection and more following a winless Euros campaign in Germany.

items.title: Former Australia cricketer Martyn in coma with meningitis
items.summary: Former Australia batter Damien Martyn has been placed in an induced coma after contracting meningitis.

items.title: Tyrrhenian Sea seeks second Quebec Stakes win at Lingfield
items.summary: Lingfield takes centre stage this afternoon, with Listed action in the Quebec Stakes headlining the all-weather card at 2pm.

items.title: Wolves draw sums up Man Utd's year: Hope followed by howlers
items.summary: Any momentum generated by Man United's Boxing Day win over Newcastle was brought to a shuddering halt on Tuesday -- this time by the worst side in the division.

items.title: Man Utd 'lack quality, fluidity and chances' - and 'expect better'
items.summary: Manchester United's players "expect better" than drawing 1-1 at home to Wolves, says stand-in captain Lisandro Martinez.
